extendedIngredients.name: bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound bacon, thinly cut into 1/4-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 pound Brussels sprouts, ends trimmed, loose leaves removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brussels sprouts, ends trimmed, loose leaves removed

title: My Brother Brussels
summary: My Brother Brussels requires around 50 minutes from start to finish. This gluten free and primal recipe serves 8 and costs 82 cents per serving. One serving contains 186 calories, 7g of protein, and 15g of fat. 71 person have made this recipe and would make it again. It works well as a side dish. Head to the store and pick up onion, brussels sprouts, butter, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. Overall, this recipe earns a pretty good spoonacular score of 49%. Similar recipes include My Brother Brussels, My Brotherâ€™s Chicken Tacos, and Two Brother's Banana Splits.
instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Fill a large pot 3/4 of the way with water and add 1 teaspoon of salt and the Brussels sprouts. Put the pot over high heat and bring to a boil. Let boil until the Brussels sprouts are just fork tender about, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, drain the sprouts and transfer to an ice bath. Let cool completely, then drain and set aside.                          Cut the Brussels sprouts into 1/4-inch lengthwise slices and set aside. Add the bacon to a medium saute pan, and cook until just crisp, then remove to a paper towel lined plate to drain. Adjust heat to medium-high, add the onions to the pan and saute until they are translucent and just beginning to caramelize, about 5 or 6 minutes. Add the butter to the pan, then add the Brussels sprouts and saute for 3 to 4 more minutes. Season with the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl or platter and sprinkle with the reserved bacon and the cheese. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Fill a large pot 3/4 of the way with water and add 1 teaspoon of salt and the Brussels sprouts.
Put the pot over high heat and bring to a boil.
Let boil until the Brussels sprouts are just fork tender about, 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat, drain the sprouts and transfer to an ice bath.
Let cool completely, then drain and set aside.
Cut the Brussels sprouts into 1/4-inch lengthwise slices and set aside.

Add the bacon to a medium saute pan, and cook until just crisp, then remove to a paper towel lined plate to drain. Adjust heat to medium-high, add the onions to the pan and saute until they are translucent and just beginning to caramelize, about 5 or 6 minutes.
Add the butter to the pan, then add the Brussels sprouts and saute for 3 to 4 more minutes. Season with the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of pepper.
Transfer to a serving bowl or platter and sprinkle with the reserved bacon and the cheese.
